content.description: The graph of <math alttext="y equals, f of x" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> on the interval <math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above.
content.question: Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="y equals, f prime of x" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>â€²</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. There are no numbers on the y axis. The graph consists of two line segments. Two open circles are included in the graph. The first line segment begins on the y axis, just above the origin, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at an open circle at x equals 2, just above the x axis. Below this open circle is a second open circle at x equals 2, just below the x axis. The second line segment begins at the second open circle, and moves upward and to the right. It crosses the x axis at 3, and ends at x equals 5, high above the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated along the x axis. There are no numbers on the y axis. The graph consists of two line segments. One open circle is included in the graph. The first line segment begins just above the x axis on the y axis in quadrant 1. It moves horizontally and to the right and ends at an open circle at x equals 2, just above the x axis. The second line segment begins at the open circle. It moves downward and to the right, crossing the x axis at 3, and ends at x equals 5, just below the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. There are no numbers on the y axis. The graph consists of two line segments. One open circle is included in the graph. The first line segment begins on the y axis, just below the origin, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at an open circle at x equals 2, just below the x axis. The second line segment begins at the open circle, and moves upward and to the right. It crosses the x axis at 3, and ends at x equals 5, above the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. There are no numbers on the y axis. The graph consists of one line segment and one curve. Two open circles are included in the graph. The line segment begins on the y axis, just above the origin, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at an open circle at x equals 2, just above the x axis. Below this open circle is a second open circle on the x axis at 2. The curve begins at the second open circle, and moves downward and to the right until it levels off and reaches a minimum at x equals 3, just below the x axis. It then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis at 4, and ends at x equals 5, high above the x axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. There are no numbers on the y axis. The graph consists of two line segments. Two open circles are included in the graph. The first line segment begins on the y axis, just above the origin, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at an open circle at x equals 2, just above the x axis. Below this open circle is a second open circle at x equals 2, just below the x axis. The second line segment begins at the second open circle, and moves upward and to the right. It crosses the x axis at 3, and ends at x equals 5, high above the x axis.
